README:
Replicating the experiments from:
Sennrich, R., Haddow, B., & Birch, A. (2015). Improving neural machine
translation models with monolingual data. arXiv preprint arXiv: 1511.06709.
http://arxiv.org/pdf/1511.06709v2.pdf

Currently a prototype model can be trained to translate from German to English.

For testing purposes, the network is for now only trained with 1000 sentences of
parallel data sampled from training-parallel-nc-v10 (first 1000 sentences). Data
is to be found in ./data as news-*.
example.txt is used for trying out the translate() function which aims to
translate an arbitrary German input.

Model can be found in NMTmodel.jl
Other functionalities are implemented in sampleWMT.jl, mostly adapted from
Knet/examples/copyseq.jl. See github.com/denizyuret/Knet.jl for more information.

Example call for training (within julia):
(Knet needs to be installed)
include("sampleWMT.jl")
sampleWMT.main("data/news-commentary-v10.de-en.de data/news-commentary-v10.de-en.en --epochs 10")
description: Class project for COMP541 (Machine Learning) at Koç University
